title: ISic003087. Fragment of an epitaph?
body:
Facsimile Images

------
[---] Νων[ῶν --- ὑπατείᾳ]
[Θεοδ]οσίου [τὸ ιε´ καὶ Βαλεν-]
[τινιανοῦ τ]ὸ δ´ Αὐγ(ούστων) [---]

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph and on Ferrua's edition; The only trace at l. 1 seems to belong neither to a N nor to a Ω. ΝΩΝ was seen by Amico in 1741.; According to Korhonen, also μετὰ τὴν ὑπατείαν is possible.

English translation

... the Nones of ... in the fifteenth consulate of Theodosius and the fourth of Valentinian, the Augusti.

Italian translation

... le None di ... durante il quindicesimo consolato di Teodosio e il quarto di Valentiniano, gli Augusti.

commentary

The inscription is probably the fragment of the end of an epitaph with a consular date: the date on which the deceased died is recorded (the indication Νων[ῶν] must have been accompanied by the day and followed by the month) and the consuls of that year. Ferrua’s supplements are based on the traces at l. 2 ΟΣΙΟ, which could only belong to the name Theodosius and the numeral δ probably indicating the number of the consulate of Theodosius’colleague, both Augusti. The only possibility is then 435 AD, the year of the fifteenth consulate of Theodosius II and the fourth of Valentian III (a date also confirmed by palaeography).

bibliography

    Amico 1741 277 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002186 36.0842bis https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 168 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028 Ferrua 1982-1983 19 no.66 fig.1g https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001996
